receipt

Class MenuItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • receipt.MenuItem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class MenuItem
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class is part of my final exam projects and is a container class for items on a merchant menu
    Author:
    Stephen Collins
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MenuItem(java.lang.String name, int price)
      Instantiates the menu item class with a new name and price using the integer argument to create a BigDecimal object
      MenuItem(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String price)
      Instantiates the menu item class with a new name and a double value price, which is converted to a BigDecimal object

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addExtra(ExtraCost extra)
      Adds a modification to the MenuItem which will increase the final price.
      java.lang.String getDiscountPercent()
      Returns a String value equal to the discount as a percentage
      int getExtraCount()
      Returns the number of extra costs added to this MenuItem
      java.util.Collection<ExtraCost> getExtraList()
      Returns the ArrayList containing this MenuItem's Extra objects
      java.math.BigDecimal getFinalPrice()
      Returns the final price after all extra costs have been added, the discount applied and the price split between the number of paying customers.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the MenuItem name
      java.math.BigDecimal getPrice()
      Returns the MenuItem price
      int getSplitCount()
      Returns the number of times this MenuItems's final price is being split
      boolean hasDiscount()
      Returns true if this MenuItem currently has a discount set
      boolean hasExtraCosts()
      Returns true if ExtraCost objects have been added to this MenuItem
      boolean isSplit()
      Returns true if this MenuItem has been split between multiple customers
      void removeDiscount()
      Removes any discount currently set for this MenuItem.
      void removeExtra(int index)
      Removes the extra modification at the argument index
      void setDiscount(java.lang.String discountPercent)
      Sets a discount for this MenuItem.
      void setName(java.lang.String name)
      Sets the MenuItem name to a new String value
      void setPrice(java.math.BigDecimal price)
      Sets the MenuItem price to a new BigDecimal value
      void setprice(int price)
      Sets the MenuItem price to a new BigDecimal value, created from the argument int value
      void setPrice(java.lang.String price)
      Sets the MenuItem price to a new BigDecimal value, created from the argument double value
      void split(int splitCount)
      Sets an integer splitter for this MenuItem to simulate splitting the item between multiple customers.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a String description of this MenuItem

      • addExtra

        public void addExtra(ExtraCost extra)
        Adds a modification to the MenuItem which will increase the final price. The item price and all extras will be summed before a discount is applied.
        Parameters:
        name -
        value -

      • setDiscount

        public void setDiscount(java.lang.String discountPercent)
        Sets a discount for this MenuItem. The name is the type of discount (Employee, Preferred Customer, etc.) and the int argument is the percentage value of the discount.
        Parameters:
        discountName -
        discountPercent -

      • removeDiscount

        public void removeDiscount()
        Removes any discount currently set for this MenuItem.

      • hasDiscount

        public boolean hasDiscount()
        Returns true if this MenuItem currently has a discount set
        Returns:

      • split

        public void split(int splitCount)
        Sets an integer splitter for this MenuItem to simulate splitting the item between multiple customers. The final price of the MenuItem will be divided by the number of times this menu item has been split (1 by default).
        Parameters:
        splitCount -

      • getSplitCount

        public int getSplitCount()
        Returns the number of times this MenuItems's final price is being split
